author: Right to Life UK
title: Miracle Baby Born Weighing Just 15 Ounces is Now 8 Months Old
text:
A premature baby boy, born at just 22 weeks and three days and who spent 137 days in the neonatal intensive care unit, beat the odds and is now eight months old.
Jadeyn Gajeski, baby Henry‚Äôs mother, was attending a routine 20-week pregnancy checkup when she found out her pregnancy was not going as well as she thought.
‚ÄúThey did the ultrasound and they saw that my cervix was shortened to nothing. It was unmeasurable is how they worded it‚Äù, Jadeyn said . ‚ÄúThey stitch your cervix, just try to hold [the] baby in longer. It did not last‚Äù.
Barely two weeks later, Jadeyn had to be rushed to Sanford Medical Center to give birth. Her son Henry, born at 22 weeks and three days, was immediately taken to the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU), which was the only facility in the area capable of looking after such a premature baby.
‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre going to come home with a baby‚Äù
Henry weighed less than a pound when he was born. His mother described the experience as ‚Äúterrifying‚Äù.
HELP LIFENEWS SAVE BABIES FROM ABORTION! Please help LifeNews.com with a donation !
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very scary and it just doesn‚Äôt seem real that you‚Äôre actually going to have a baby so soon. You know, you were just celebrating. You‚Äôre halfway through your pregnancy and here you are. So you have no idea how it‚Äôs going to go‚Äù, she said .
‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt breathe. Your chest is tight. You‚Äôre just constantly worried. And then you see him and he‚Äôs see-through and he is hooked up to all these things, You don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre going to come home with a baby. You really don‚Äôt‚Äù.
However, Henry was in the hands of a specialist NICU team, who supported him for 137 days in hospital. One of the doctors, Dr Mohamed Mohamed, said that the hospital has seen about a dozen very premature babies like Henry in the last five years, and that they have a survival rate of about 60% at this hospital.
‚ÄúWe have a micropreemie program, which is a specialized program to take care of the little ones‚Äù, Dr Mohamed said . ‚ÄúThe smaller you are, you‚Äôll have immature organ systems and that includes the brain, the small intestine, the lungs, the heart and the skin, the immune system. Every system might cause or pose a risk of having a life-threatening event. In the case of Henry, he needed to be on the breathing machine right away. And he stayed on the breathing machine for two months‚Äù.
Four months later, he was able to go home
In addition to being on the breathing machine, Henry experienced a perforated bowel and an infection of the heart while in hospital.
However, after over four months, he was discharged from the hospital and is now mostly healthy at eight months old.
Dr Mohamed said ‚ÄúWe put [in] the effort, and we work hard toward having a good outcome. But when I see Henry now in front of me and he‚Äôs interacting and he‚Äôs doing very well, this is what gives me joy for my job‚Äù.
‚ÄúIt really makes you feel like you have a miracle in your hands‚Äù, Henry‚Äôs mother said . ‚ÄúHe is the strongest boy I know. I mean, he‚Äôs just amazing. I know he is really meant to be here‚Äù.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the best thing ever. I mean, you just look at him randomly at home and you get tears. You do. Because he‚Äôs a miracle‚Äù.
More premature babies are surviving from 22 weeks gestation
At 22 weeks, Henry was born below the current UK abortion limit of 24 weeks. Babies like Henry highlight a clear contradiction at the heart of our abortion law and current medical practice.
On the one hand, the law permits ending the lives of babies at 22 and 23 weeks, and, on the other hand, current medical practice strives to save the lives of many babies born prematurely at 22 or 23 weeks gestation.
The annual abortion statistics for England and Wales in 2021 (the most recent year for which a full year of data is available) reveal that 755 ‚Äòground C‚Äô abortions were performed when the baby was at 22 or 23 weeks gestation (ground C is the statutory ground under which the vast majority of abortions are permitted and there is currently a 24-week time limit for abortions performed under this statutory ground).
Spokesperson for Right To Life UK, Catherine Robinson, said ‚ÄúIt is so uplifting to hear of stories like Henry‚Äôs and the dedication of the medical team who supported him through so many difficulties in hospital. Very premature babies demonstrate how resilient even the youngest humans in our society are and point to the humanity of the children in the womb‚Äù.
LifeNews Note: Republished with permission from Right to Life UK.

author: LLB staff reporter
title: The last few days of 2023 will remain unsettled with snow and rain in parts of the UK - London Business News | Londonlovesbusiness.com
text: From Saturday and area of low pressure will push in from the west which will be dominant in the feature to the forecast leading into the new year. Storm Gerrit has bought challenging conditions that have now eased, on Thursday the weather will be blustery with showers, with some heavy rain in parts. Friday will continue with rain and wind and some central locations will brighten up, until Saturday morning which will see a possible deep area of low pressure moving in from the west and will affect Ireland and western parts of the UK. It is possible that snow will fall to lower levels for a short period of time across Scotland, with transient snow across the higher grounds in northern England also. Met Office Chief Forecaster, Steven Ramsdale said, ‚ÄúThis system is likely to bring a range of weather including hill snow. ‚ÄúHeavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. ‚ÄúHowever, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.‚Äù Looking further into 2024, Nick Silkstone, Met Office Deputy Chief Forecaster said, ‚ÄúThrough to mid-January, there is a signal for a shift in the pattern compared to the winter so far, with more settled and colder-than-average conditions becoming increasingly likely.‚Äù

author: /news/author/gabe-ross
title: 'Bail Out,' Says Investor About Intel Stock
text:
Intel (
[NASDAQ:INTC](https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/intc)) had a downer of a year in 2024. While much of the tech industry reaped the rewards of the [AI](https://www.tipranks.com/compare-stocks/artificial-intelligence) revolution, Intel lagged significantly behind its data center competitors, particularly the market-dominating Nvidia. As a result, Intel shares lost more than half of their value during the year.
Stay Ahead of the Market:
- Discover outperforming stocks and invest smarter with
[Top Smart Score Stocks](https://www.tipranks.com/screener/top-smart-score-stocks)
- Filter, analyze, and streamline your search for investment opportunities using
[Tipranks' Stock Screener](https://www.tipranks.com/screener/stocks)
Intel‚Äôs Board of Directors was clearly unhappy with the company‚Äôs trajectory, expressing their displeasure by removing long-time Intel veteran Pat Gelsinger from his CEO position in December. Gelsinger, who was brought back to lead Intel in February 2021, had evidently failed to win over the board with his ‚Äò5 Nodes in 4 Years‚Äô strategy.
While company ‚Äòshake-ups‚Äô can cause instability, they may also help struggling firms begin to turn things around. Not so in this case, asserts one investor known by the pseudonym Value Edge, who argues that Intel‚Äôs board has failed to learn from previous mistakes.
‚ÄúThe Board‚Äôs co-CEO decision mirrors past mistakes, focusing on product groups while neglecting the critical foundry segment, risking Intel‚Äôs future competitiveness,‚Äù the investor opined.
Value Edge explains that Gelsinger was in the midst of guiding crucial significant technological developments that could have helped Intel regain its competitive advantage. The investor adds that the company veteran of nearly three decades was exceptionally familiar with Intel, its technology, and the opportunities (and challenges) within the industry.
The newly appointed co-CEOs, however, come from finance and marketing backgrounds ‚Äì lacking the technical expertise Gelsinger brought to the role. As Value Edge points out, this gap in technical knowledge could further hinder Intel‚Äôs efforts to reclaim its standing in the rapidly evolving tech landscape.
‚ÄúThe board wants to focus on the products group, which lost its moat in the first place due to the lagging foundry segment that Gelsinger was trying to fix,‚Äù Value Edge argued. The investor contends that an enhanced emphasis on the products group demonstrates a lack of interest in pursuing the investments needed to turn Intel‚Äôs Foundry competitive once more.
‚ÄúThe current Board is made up of many of the same folks that have overseen the entire awful past decade for Intel,‚Äù concludes Value Edge, who, unsurprisingly, professes scant faith in the current leadership. The investor is therefore downgrading INTC to a Strong Sell. (To watch The Value Edge‚Äôs track record,
[click here](https://www.tipranks.com/experts/bloggers/the-value-edge))
Over on Wall Street, however, the jury is still out. With 1 Buy, 21 Hold, and 5 Sell recommendations, INTC holds a consensus Hold (i.e., Neutral) rating. Nevertheless, its 12-month average price target of $24.53 suggests an upside of 23%. (See
[INTC stock forecast](https://www.tipranks.com/stocks/intc/forecast))
To find good ideas for stocks trading at attractive valuations, visit TipRanks‚Äô
[Best Stocks to Buy](https://www.tipranks.com/stocks-to-buy), a tool that unites all of TipRanks‚Äô equity insights.
Disclaimer: The opinions expressed in this article are solely those of the featured investor. The content is intended to be used for informational purposes only. It is very important to do your own analysis before making any investment.

author: Esteban Valverde
title: En vivo: Mbapp√© anota tres dianas y el PSG golea en regreso de Keylor Navas al arco
text:
Llego el sexto para el PSG
Por medio de penal, Goncalo Guedes hizo el sexto gol. El delantero aprovech√≥ la oportunidad que le dio Mbapp√© de anotar.
PSG ya le pone cifras de esc√°ndalo
El Par√≠s Saint Germain consigui√≥ en 60 minutos ya ponerle n√∫meros de goleada a su victoria sobre el Revel de la sexta divisi√≥n de Francia, por las fases previa de la Copa de Francia.
Mbapp√© se destap√≥ con tres anotaciones, mientras que Marco Asensio hizo una m√°s y los parisinos ganan 5 a 0 con facilidad.
Gol del PSG
El PSG consigui√≥ la segunda anotaci√≥n del duelo gracias a un contragolpe por derecha, el cual termin√≥ con un centro que un zaguero del rival envi√≥ al fondo de la red. 2-0.
Keylor reaccion√≥ a tiempo para evitar ca√≠da de su marco
Keylor Navas recibi√≥ un disparo de larga distancia, en el minuto 28, el nacional tuvo que reaccionar con velocidad para evitar la diana del adversario y envi√≥ el bal√≥n a tiro de esquina.
Gol del PSG
El PSG domin√≥ los primeros 15 del juego y consigui√≥ en el 16 ponerse en ventaja, gracias a una diana de Mbapp√©.
El arquero tico Keylor Navas no tuvo en el comienzo del cotejo protagonismo y fue un espectador m√°s.
Alineaci√≥n del PSG
üÜó La composition parisienne üÜö US Revel‚Äî Paris Saint-Germain (@PSG_inside)
üîú
[#USRPSG] [pic.twitter.com/o7lB3dAXEv] [January 7, 2024]
La previa
La √∫ltima vez que Keylor Navas jug√≥ con el Par√≠s Saint Germain fue el 23 de enero del 2023, es decir, pr√°cticamente hace un a√±o, precisamente por el Torneo de Copa galo. Ahora, Luis Enrique, t√©cnico espa√±ol, le dar√° la oportunidad al nacional nuevamente en la misma competici√≥n y ante U.S Revel de la sexta divisi√≥n de Francia.
Navas, quien tuvo un segundo semestre del 2023 en la sombra de Gianluigi Donnarumma y se vio afectado varias veces por dolencias musculares, por fin tendr√° su ansiado regreso al marco. Precisamente el retorno de Keylor se da en un momento clave, porque al tico solamente le resta este semestre de contrato y es libre de decidir su futuro.
La prensa habla sobre el regreso de Keylor
Medios franceses han dado la informaci√≥n del regreso de Keylor Navas a la porter√≠a del PSG. Tambi√©n Diario AS de Espa√±a hizo un an√°lisis y afirm√≥ que este podr√≠a ser uno de los √∫ltimos encuentros del centroamericano en Par√≠s.
‚ÄúA sus 37 a√±os, Keylor esta posiblemente ante uno de sus √∫ltimos partidos con la camiseta del PSG, ya que incluso Arnau Tenas, fichado en verano, le hab√≠a adelantado en la rotaci√≥n de la porter√≠a, aunque el canterano del Barcelona no ha entrado en la convocatoria para el partido de Copa ante el Revel por unas molestias musculares‚Äù, asegura el medio espa√±ol

author: Portal Uai Entretenimento
title: Marieta Severo visita amigos no Retiro dos Artistas, no Rio de Janeiro
text: [ ](https://www.uai.com.br/app/entretenimento/comportamento/2023/07/15/not-comportamento,326835/paula-fernandes-encanta-de-fio-dental-laranja-e-explana-corpaco-sarado.shtml) Paula Fernandes encanta de fio-dental laranja e explana corpa√ßo sarado Nesta semana, o presidente, Stepan Nercessian, criticou √† falta de mobiliza√ß√£o da classe art√≠stica para ajudar a institui√ß√£o Nesta ter√ßa-feira (16), [Marieta Severo](https://www.uai.com.br/app/entretenimento/famosos/2022/07/28/not-famosos,294924/a-ancine-faz-de-tudo-para-atrapalhar-o-cinema-dispara-marieta-severo.shtml) visitou o Retiro dos Artistas, no Rio de Janeiro. A atriz foi visitar o ator Paulo C√©sar Pereio, ex-marido de Cissa Guimar√£es. Atualmente, a institui√ß√£o abriga 53 artistas, no entanto, a casa passa por dificuldades e precisa de doa√ß√µes. Stepan Nercessian, presidente do Retiro dos Artistas, criticou a falta de mobiliza√ß√£o da pr√≥pria classe art√≠stica: "Vou atr√°s de empres√°rio, advogado e pol√≠tico para pedir que n√£o cortem a √°gua. Mas artista tem que ter consci√™ncia, devia vir aqui sempre. Quando v√™m, ficam encantados. Fui at√© num psic√≥logo para entender por que os artistas se mobilizam at√© para salvar hamster e aqui temos que pedir pelo amor de Deus. O psic√≥logo respondeu que talvez seja resqu√≠cio daquele passado, de eles n√£o quererem se ver nessa imagem de 'olha o que vai acontecer com voc√™'", disse ele, a uma entrevista para o Globo. Al√©m de Paulo Cesar, Marieta tamb√©m reencontrou o ator Silvio Pozatto, de 67 anos. Ele chegou √† institui√ß√£o h√° um ano e meio. O ator busca "uma vida mais segura e tranquila". Silveio sofre de parkinson h√° 12 anos, solteiro e sem filhos, suas √∫nicas companhias s√£o os amigos do Retiro e um gato: ‚ÄúGosto daqui. E quero fazer a cirurgia de implante de eletr√¥nico no c√©rebro para recuperar a fala e os movimentos e voltar a atuar‚Äù, disse.

author: Brianna Rhodes; Feb
title: Office of the Provost Announces Do Good Innovator Awardees | School of Architecture, Planning & Preservation
text: [View photographs from the Provost's Do Good Innovator Awards Celebration](https://www.flickr.com/photos/142484476@N02/albums/72177720315367205/) The Do Good Institute, in partnership with the Office of the Provost, is proud to recognize 57 incredible UMD staff and faculty with the Provost‚Äôs Do Good Innovator Award. Three faculty members from MAPP were honored among the campus community members who create, nurture, expand and amplify social impact through education, programs and research, in and outside the classroom. Brandy Espinola, Julie Gabrielli and Marccus Hendricks were nominated by their colleagues who recognized their meaningful work. The award reflects their impressive commitment to our Do Good Campus core values: Experiential Learning; Social Impact; Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging; Service to Humanity; Collaboration; and Innovation. Learn more about each faculty member‚Äôs impact below: [Brandy Espinola](/people/brandy-espinola), Climate Resilience and Sustainability Program Director, Environmental Finance Center Brandy is leading a collaborative effort to implement the county-wide Climate Action Plan that she helped draft last year with multiple government departments, local nonprofits and county residents in Prince George‚Äôs County, Maryland. [Julie Gabrielli](/people/julie-gabrielli-ncarb-leed), Associate Clinical Professor, Architecture Program Julie dedicates herself to sustainable architecture, both through her professional architecture career and her teaching practice. This has allowed her to have a significant impact on the way others see the role of architecture in protecting and preserving the natural environment. [Marccus Hendricks](/people/marccus-hendricks), Ph.D., Associate Professor and Director at SIRJ Lab, Urban Studies and Planning Program Marccus is deeply committed to community-engaged research in communities of color, which are often vulnerable to natural hazards. What makes this work unique is that Marccus and his team co-develop data collection and analysis with communities and their residents, making those living in the study area also project collaborators. The university and MAPP are happy to celebrate our faculty, who have been hard at work tackling the grand challenges of our time in service of the public good. Thank you so much for all your efforts, Brandy, Julie and Marccus, to make MAPP and UMD a thriving Do Good school and campus.

author: Keith Lane
title: chevron-right
text: {h2}Sunshine for weekend{/h2}{p}The final weekend of 2023 is calm and pleasant for the central Gulf Coast. After a start in the middle 30s, our Saturday will feature blue skies, sunshine, light wind, and highs in the middle{ } 50s. Sunday morning starts in the middle and upper 30s but warms further, to the lower or middle 60s. It will be an outstanding New Year's Eve with abundant sunshine.{br}{/p}{p}Sunday evening remains dry and calm. With a light southwesterly wind, we'll gradually see clouds increase overnight, heading into New Year's Day. At the stroke of midnight, temperatures should be near 50 degrees. New Year's Day has showers over about a third of the area, by late afternoon. Highs will still be in the lower 60s. Plan for daily changes after that with Tuesday being sunny, dry and cool, and Wednesday bring more rain, before we dry out for Thursday.{/p}{p}{strong}Chief Meteorologist Alan Sealls{/strong}{/p}{p}NBC 15-area forecasts from the National Weather Service - {a href="https://www.weather.gov/mob/marine" target="_blank" title="https://www.weather.gov/mob/marine
